answerText: Thomas Young[10] Young's double-slit can be used to understand these periodic objects, which contains a bunch of slits equally spaced apart. The spacing between the slits has to be bigger than the wavelength of light in order to work.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 8 | 1 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In his most famous theoretical construct, he showed that when the difference in path length is equal to an integer multiple of the wavelength, constructive interference occurs. For 10 points each: [10] Name this person who performed the double-slit experiment to understand interference with light. He's also the namesake of a quantity equal to the ratio of stress to strain.
